name: Silverybield Foss
description:
A tiny scenic story made over a couple of days in January 2018, using bitsy.

Controls: Arrow keys to move or advance text.

The location is loosely based on Carlingill in the Howgill Fells in Cumbria, UK. The name "Silverybield" comes from the (unrelated) location in this news story, which I felt was too nice a word not to use. Bield is an old dialect word for shelter.

Foss is the Old Norse word for waterfall, usually found as "force" in place names. You can read more about Cumbrian toponyms here, even though it has nothing much to do with this game :)

-Ed
